lines.text: No, I am a tramp. What can I say?
Well, you know, one person's tramp is another person's free spirit.

There'll be a trial when the circuit judge comes to town. Do you know him? We go hunting quail together when he's here. He's a damn fine shot and a very fair man - completely impartial. He'll hear the case, weigh the evidence... and Duell McCall will hang!
You see how stupid you are! The Company is the law in this town... and I'm the Company!
Marshal Dancey! I had no idea it's our time of the month to have you here!
You make it sound like a physical affliction.
You're not the law. There is no law! You're just another man with a gun... only you're paid by a better class of people.
Oh, those posters on Duell McCall - they're not legal. That's bounty hunting.
He's an enemy of the Company.
The Company is not the law.
The Company pays more than the law. How much does the law pay you, Marshal?
Are you trying to bribe me, Mr. Ballard?
If I have to try to bribe a man, Marshal, he's probably unbribable.
Why aren't you out there working?
What do you girls got now - a union? Get out there!

The kind of men that come to a place like this, they don't come here with a lot of tender feelings. In fact, me and the other girls are about the only human beings in their lives that they can get even with for all their misery. They give us their misery every night.
